etymology.description: 广(廣) (guǎng, "house") + 木(木) (mù, "tree/wood") = wooden furniture (bed) in a house
etymology.interpretation: The character 床(床) (chuáng, "bed") signifies a piece of wooden furniture located within a house. The inclusion of 木(木), meaning 'wood,' intuitively aligns with beds being made from wooden materials, while 广(廣) represents the enclosing structure of a house, emphasizing the indoor placement of furniture.

examples.chinese: 我睡在床上(我睡在床上)。
买了新床(買了新床)，感觉睡眠更好(感覺睡眠更好)。
examples.pinyin: Mǎile xīn chuáng, gǎnjué shuìmián gèng hǎo.
examples.english: I bought a new bed, and I feel my sleep is better.

examples.chinese: 孩子在床上玩耍(孩子在床上玩耍)，笑声充满房间(笑聲充滿房間)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi zài chuáng shàng wánshuǎ, xiàoshēng chōngmǎn fángjiān.
examples.english: The child plays on the bed, and laughter fills the room.
